image.altText: A young woman smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Police say the major search for Celine Cremer in Tasmania's north-west has been suspended, but they still hope to find answers for the 31-year-old's family.

title.children: Search for missing Belgian tourist in Tasmanian wilderness suspended

image.altText: A book cover reading 'Special Operations Group' by Christophe Glasl

items.synopsis: A chapter detailing author Christopher Glasl's involvement during the Port Arthur massacre has been called inaccurate by Victoria Police.

title.children: Publisher pulls former Victoria Police officer's memoir from sale after claims of inaccuracies

image.altText: Bales of plastic waste next to a bobcat vehicle

items.synopsis: Analysis commissioned by conservation groups finds skyrocketing levels of plastic use are contributing to global warming more than previously thought.

title.children: 'We can't rely on recycling': Environmentalists sound alarm on plastic's climate threat

image.altText: Hands take Australian money notes out of a wallet.

items.synopsis: About 14 million Australians will be prepping their tax returns over the coming weeks and months.

title.children: 10 million Aussies claimed this tax offset in 2020/21. Now it’s gone and leaving a hole in 2023 refunds

image.altText: A woman and man with blonde hair sit next to a floral arrangement

items.synopsis: Older people downsizing to smaller homes is one way housing stock can be used more efficiently but despite government moves to make it more attractive financially, barriers still exist.

title.children: Downsizing could be part of the solution to the housing crisis. So why aren't more people doing it?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Paul Keating

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese refuses to comment on Paul Keating's attack on the NATO secretary-general ahead of the alliance's meeting tomorrow.

title.children: PM calls NATO boss a 'friend of Australia' after Keating's 'supreme fool' comment

image.altText: A young teenager wearing a hoodie, sitting on a hospital bed. He is looking at the camera with a concerned expression.

items.synopsis: Desperate families have been unable to get appointments for their trans kids at this public hospital as resignations and a broader fight over gender care take a toll.

title.children: 'We did all we could': Noah was desperate for gender care. He died waiting for help

image.altText: The exterior of Crown Casino in Melbourne under a blue sky.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for gambling giant Crown have urged a judge not to "interfere" in an agreement over a multi-million dollar money laundering fine.

title.children: Crown Resorts lawyers urge judge not to 'interfere' in money-laundering fine agreement

image.altText: A middle-aged Indigenous woman with long hair, standing in bushland.

items.synopsis: A representative for an Indigenous family in Western Australia's Midwest has disputed a claim that a Jubilee event was stopped because of recently implemented cultural heritage laws.

title.children: 'She didn't walk this land': Decision to honour Queen brings tree-planting event to a halt

image.altText: A small brown animal behind some grass

items.synopsis: How the pademelon often tricks the world into thinking it is the extinct thylacine, and seven other wild pademelon facts.

title.children: Preyed upon and often mistaken for another species — meet the pademelon

image.altText: Noel Pearson stands at a microphone.

items.synopsis: Famous Indigenous elders from across the country have gathered to speak on the importance of Yes votes in the Voice referendum. They say it's our chance to 'seize history' and make a real change.

title.children: 'It's our one chance': Elders make impassioned Voice plea ahead of 'most important event in 250 years'

image.altText: View of sea lion showing sea lion head looking at two dolphins and a ball of bait fish

items.synopsis: Cameras are fitted to endangered Australian sea lions in a bid to document their foraging habitats, but the results have revealed so much more to excited researchers, including a snappy encounter with a shark.

title.children: Sea lion cam the 'best live TV you can watch' as researchers take a plunge with endangered seals

image.altText: man in a t-shirt standing in front of a beach sunset

items.synopsis: A 48-year-old man was arrested near Nambucca Heads on the NSW Mid North Coast on Friday, more than 300 kilometres from where police allege he stole a dog.

title.children: Man accused of stealing Bowie the blind Gold Coast dog faces court

image.altText: A group of female soccer players pose for a team photo

items.synopsis: With the Women's World Cup just over a week away and Australia putting the finishing touches on their preparation, one of the Matildas most experienced players has revealed how they plan to rise to the challenge.

title.children: 'It's actually happening': Why the pressure is on the Matildas like never before

image.altText: A speed gun showing 253 kilometres per hour.

items.synopsis: A South Australian magistrate has described an L-plater who was caught doing 253 kilometres per hour as "probably the most dangerous man in the state" at that time.

title.children: Judge labels learner driver caught extreme speeding 'the most dangerous man in the state'

image.altText: Oranges in boxes branded with the business name "Nippy's".

items.synopsis: The company received a $120,000 fine and a criminal conviction over the 2020 incident. The SA Employment Tribunal found the risk had been foreseen in a safety assessment completed years before the "traumatic" accident.

title.children: Juice company Nippy's convicted over workplace scalping of 18-year-old woman

image.altText: A police cordon is placed across a road, with a large crowd gathered near buildings running along the street.

items.synopsis: A 25-year-old male suspect has been arrested after the latest mass stabbing at a kindergarten in China, where several other fatal attacks targeting students and schools have occurred nationwide in recent years.

title.children: Six killed, including three children, in China kindergarten attack

image.altText: Drone shot of a boat parked up on a tropical island.

items.synopsis: The draft includes potential opportunities for new eco-resorts, a village centre, and cultural and nature-based activities to encourage longer stays.

title.children: Plans to revitalise abandoned party paradise on Great Barrier Reef released

image.altText: A sign at the SA and WA border at dusk.

items.synopsis: A court has heard a passenger in a car was "totally ignorant" about more than $4 million in methylamphetamine and cocaine allegedly hidden beneath the driver's seat.

title.children: Perth woman claims she was 'totally ignorant' of $4 million worth of drugs seized at WA border

image.altText: Crowds stand by the water's edge

items.synopsis: Authorities are deploying crocodile traps and have barricaded the entrance to Wangi Falls in Litchfield National Park after confirming the attack on Monday afternoon.

title.children: 'Do not enter the water': 2-metre croc attack prompts authorities to close popular NT waterfall

image.altText: two men inside a gym

items.synopsis: Tarek Zahed was denied bail for a fifth time, after the court heard he was suffering "serious health conditions" from an assassination attempt last year.

title.children: 'No good': Comanchero bikie boss refused bail over alleged Sydney murder

image.altText: The mangled remains of a silver car lying in a grassy field next a country road.

items.synopsis: Shepparton resident Harinder Singh has been bailed on a $270,000 bond and has surrendered his passport. He was seriously hurt in the January crash, which left four occupants of the car he was driving dead.

title.children: 41-year-old pleads not guilty over crash in northern Victoria that left four dead

image.altText: A large round fish with huge fins and spotted skin.

items.synopsis: Xavier Doerr says his yacht capsized in huge seas when it collided with one of the ocean's strangest inhabitants. What is a sunfish? And could it take out a boat? Experts give their take.

title.children: Why rescued sailor believes one 'bizarre' fish stopped his round-Australia record bid in its tracks

image.altText: PNG man Eric Gwale wearing military fatigue sitting on a boat wearing sunglasses

items.synopsis: The family of a Papua New Guinea Defence Force soldier who was shot dead in a "tragic accident" during a training exercise last week are calling for greater transparency from the force in investigating his death.

title.children: PNG family demand answers after soldier shot dead in a training exercise

image.altText: Man smiling while holding two glass awards in front of a red banner

items.synopsis: After convincing BHP to trial his high-tech air conditioners, Steven Heaton promised some of Australia's biggest businessmen huge returns if they invested in his company. Now he's behind bars.

title.children: The air conditioner scam that duped a former AFL chair, a former state treasurer and other business high-flyers

image.altText: Emma wears a white sleeveless dress and stands closely to Raj who is in a tuxedo with a red rose on his lapel

items.synopsis: Raj Jayarajah has been remembered as a "much loved" husband and father after he died following a brain haemorrhage suffered while he was on holiday in Bali.

title.children: Melbourne man Raj Jayarajah dies after suffering brain haemorrhage in Bali

image.altText: Two bowls of sugar, one containing sugar cubes and the other granulated sugar

items.synopsis: The Ashes may have soured ties between Australia and the UK last week, but Aussie sugar is set to ease tensions with a sweet deal.

title.children: Australian sugar farmers happy to be back helping the UK stay sweet

image.altText: a young woman standing in waist-deep water in the ocean smiling at the camera

items.synopsis: Chelsea Hall shared her experience with chronic bloating online. What she wasn't expecting was to see herself advertising pills that claim to fix it — pills she says she's never taken, promoted by a company she's never been a customer of.

title.children: 'They've never even sent me a message': Chelsea's videos appeared in an ad for a product she's never used

image.altText: Very dark plumes of smoke across the water.

items.synopsis: The vessel sank little more than an hour after emergency crews were called to the scene at Airlie Beach.

title.children: Three children, four adults rescued as fire destroys boat off Queensland coast

image.altText: woman with glasses with serious look on face

items.synopsis: A new study will look at cancer survivors and how the fear of recurrence can impact on a person's quality of life.

title.children: Michelle Hensel survived cancer, then lost her son to the deadly disease. She now lives with the fear it could return

image.altText: An aerial view of a park next to a river

items.synopsis: The Harbour Park restores public access to half of the currently empty site in Central Barangaroo, and will feature Indigenous culture, interactive art, water play areas and ponds.

title.children: New harbourside park completes 'last piece of the puzzle' at Barangaroo
